intro: Rottboellia articulata, commonly known as the jointed grass or African grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Rottboellia articulata is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various conditions make it both a useful forage plant and a potential weed.
